activities:
OmniComm Systems, Inc. is an eClinical software and services company that helps pharmaceutical, biotechnology, CROs, research and medical device organizations to perform clinical trials.
OmniComm provides online electronic case report forms to physicians at investigative sites (hospitals, universities, medical practices) to capture patient data, the data is centrally hosted in the US.  In this context OmniComm transmits 2 kinds of data from the European Economic Area (EEA) and/or Switzerland into the USA.

- Personal information about the participating physicians, the sponsor and supporting industries like Clinical Research Organizations, laboratories etc.   This data usually includes address, telephone number and e-mail address. OmniComm saves this information in a client database. Only a limited number of authorized and trained OmniComm staff members have access to this database.  The personal information of our clients is needed to support the users of our data capture software in case of problems.  
- Patient data.    All patient data is fully anonymized. Patient information is key-coded at its origin at the investigator site to not reveal the identity of the individuals. Therefore this data does not fall under the regulations of the Safe Harbor.

OmniComm may transfer information concerning employees, applicants, customers, prospects, partners and suppliers on a confidential basis from branch offices to the headquarters in the US, as well as to OmniComm’s business advisors (such as auditors and legal counsel).
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: OmniComm Systems collects the following types of personal data: Data from clinical trial subjects, Contact information from clinical trial staff, Personal information from employees, business partners, investors
privacyprograms: OmniComm Systems Inc. is not a member of any privacy program today.
recoursemech:
American Arbitration Association (AAA) (http://www.adr.org/) will be used for unresolved disputes. 
For human resource data, the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) will be used for unresolved disputes.
